attributes.action: Parliament should prevent the award of a knighthood to Jacob Rees-Mogg.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament is intended to represent the cherished ideal of democratic governance.  The Honours system is only justified if it reflects (and rewards) a comparable aspiration among all people for that same high ideal of selfless service to the nation.
attributes.background: At a critical time, Mr Rees-Mogg stretched out on a Commons bench, in a gesture that was interpreted by a great many people as showing his contempt for the Parliamentary process of which he is a part.  It is - or should be - unthinkable that such a man should receive a notable honour.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions asking for people's honours to be taken away. You can find out more about how honours are taken away here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/having-honours-taken-away-forfeiture
